workspaces.title: Workspaces — $t(common:main.title)
workspaces.description: Create new Workspaces and new Apps, edit them, and run them

welcome.title: Welcome {{name}},
welcome.content: Here is your gallery, find our suggestions to help you start a workspace or search among your already created workspaces.

suggestions.title: Suggestions
suggestions.error: An error has occurred. Contact support if the problem persists

workspace.title: "{{name}}" Workspace — $t(common:main.title)

empty.title: <0>Your Workspace has not yet generated any activity…</0><1>Start creating, add Pages, Automations, Apps!</1>
empty.subtitle: Not sure where to start?

page.title: Page
page.text: Create a page according to the need and the role

automation.title: Automation
automation.text: Create an automation to execute instructions

app.title: App
app.text: Install an App to add integrations

workspace.dirtyWarning: Your current work haven't been saved. Quit anyway ?

confirm.title: Do you want to delete the "{{name}}" workspace?
confirm.content: Warning, the data will be lost.

slug.label: Subdomain
slug.error: Must be composed only of unaccented alphanumeric characters, spaces and "-", "_"
slug.unique: This subdomain is no longer available. Please choose another one.

create.label: Create a version
create.description: Create a new version to which you can return at any time even after saving changes to your Workspace.
create.name: Describe your version if you wish
create.success: New version created. You will be able to find it in the Activity of your Workspace.

rollback.label: Rollback to this version
rollback.description: Rollback to this version. Please note that the current state of your Workspace will not be kept.
rollback.confirm: Please note that the current state of your Workspace will be lost if you have not saved a version.
rollback.success: Back to the previous version with success.

create.description_first: Create your first workspace to start automating your work
create.label: Create a workspace

running.label: Events are displayed in real time
running.description: Start the update in real time. Please note that the performance of your browser may be degraded.

reload.description_off: Disable real time update to reload events manually.

filters.title: Filters

query.label: Filter specific fields

filters.empty: No results were found using your filters. Try another search ?

suggestions.title: Filter suggestions
suggestions.help: Selection of pre-set filters to help you find your most useful events.

automations.empty: An automation describes what to do and when to do it

save.label: Save
save.reason_AlreadyUsedError: Slug is already in use, please choose another one.

source.label: See code
source.help: Displays the structure of the automation in raw format

events.title: Events
events.help: Automation will be run everytime one of this event will be fired.

endpoint.title: URL
endpoint.copied: URL has been copied in your clipboard
endpoint.help: Automation will be run everytime the URL will be hit.

schedules.title: Schedules
schedules.help: You can schedule your Automation to run at certain recurring times. You can add several schedules in crontab format. Warning, the minimum time between two executions is 15mn.

instruction.label: {{context}}
instruction.description_emit: Issue an event of your choice to which you can associate a data object. If you choose to make this event private, it will not be heard by other workspaces and Apps.
instruction.description_repeat: Repeats a list of instructions on each element of a data array passed in parameter (`on`) or up to a certain number of iterations (`until`).
instruction.description_all: Executes all the instructions of the group in parallel. The following instructions will be executed only after all the instructions of this group are finished.
instruction.description_wait: Blocks the processing of the instruction list until the event passed in parameter is triggered.
instruction.description_set: Sets a value in a variable.
instruction.description_conditions: Test conditions in order to execute this or that group of instructions.
instruction.description_comment: Do nothing more than display a comment in the list of instructions.
instruction.anyFieldErrorTooltip: This is just a warning, the instruction will still save

additionnalProperties.label: Additional properties
additionnalProperties.description: Define additional properties in the form of a JSON

output.label: Assign the output to the variable
output.description: The output of this Automation can be stored in a variable to be used in a next instruction.

event.label: Event name
event.description: Enter the name of the event you want to trigger.

payload.label: Payload (optional, JSON format)
payload.description: You can attach any type of data to your event.

target.label: Target
target.description: By default, the event is sent to everyone. You can target a specific recipient with these settings.

userTopic.label: Topic
userTopic.description: Specify a topic to categorize the message.

userId.label: User ID
userId.description: Target a particular user by his ID.

sessionId.label: Session ID
sessionId.description: Target a particular user session by its ID.

private.label: Private
private.description: The event will not be autocomplete for users of your workspace once it is transformed into an App.

autocomplete.label: Autocompletion
autocomplete.description: Specifies how your event will be offered to autocomplete for users of your workspace once transformed into an App.

persist.label: Persist
persist.description: Whether to persist this event or not. Defaults to true

oneOf.label: One of these events:
oneOf.description: The automation can wait until a particular event is triggered.

event.label: Event name
event.description: Indicate the name of the event that will restart your automation.

filters.label: Filters
filters.description: Filter the event according to the values of the properties that accompany it.

cancelTriggers.label: Cancel trigger
cancelTriggers.description: By checking this option, the event will be cancelled and will not trigger any other automation.

timeout.label: Timeout in seconds
timeout.description: Time in seconds to wait before resuming the execution of the automation.

output.label: Output variable name
output.description: Indicate the name of a variable in which the data accompanying the event that unlocked this step will be stored.

interface.label: Value structure
interface.description: You can choose the data structure of one of the blocks available in your Workspace to facilitate its filling.

name.label: Variable name
name.description: Indicate the name of the variable in which your data will be stored. You can then access it using the interpolation syntax. For example, a variable named `foo` will be accessible elsewhere using `{{foo}}`.

value.label: Value
value.description: Put any value of any type here. You can also use interpolation to store data from another variable.

type.label: Merge type
type.description: Choose merge to merge the target variable with the value. The value has priority.

name.label: Variable name
name.description: Enter the name of the variable you want to delete. Its value will no longer be accessible.

scope.label: Scope
scope.description: Scope of the stop. By default, only this automation will be stopped. If you choose "$t(automations.instruction.form.break.scope.enum.all)", the parent automations that called this one will also be stopped.

url.label: HTTP address
url.description: URL of a publicly accessible web service.

method.label: HTTP method
method.description: HTTP method to use for the request.

headers.label: Headers
headers.description: List of key values constituting the headers of the query.

body.label: Body
body.description: The body accompanying the request. Can be of any type.

emitErrors.label: Emit event when errors occur
emitErrors.description: If the status code of the HTTP response is 4xx or 5xx, emits a runtime.fetch.failed event by default.

multipart.label: multipart/form-data
multipart.description: Data to be sent as multipart/form-data.

value.label: Value
value.description: Must be a string. Raw files must be given in base64.

filename.label: File name
filename.description: The file name is required when the value is a base64 encoded file.

output.label: Output variable name
output.description: Save the answer of the query in a variable accessible in the rest of your automation thanks to the interpolation.

on.label: On an array's items
on.description: Name of the array variable to loop on.

until.label: Until
until.description: Loop a specific number of times

output.label: {{output}}

edit.title: Return value:
edit.description: Value returned by the automation. Can be a static value in the form of a string or a JSON object or even a variable generated during the execution of your automation surrounded by braces (ex: {{maVar}})
edit.label: Value

output.description: Indicate the name of a variable in which to store the output of this instruction in order to exploit it in the continuation of the automation

private.label: Internal use
private.description: If you enable this setting, Automation will be visible as an instruction only in this same Workspace. When you publish your app, its users will not see it.

disabled.label: Disabled
disabled.description: If you enable this setting, Automation will not be executed anymore and simply ignored

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: Specification of the parameters that can be passed to your automation when it is used as a statement of another automation. A form will be generated according to the structure you specify here.

save.label: Save
save.reason_AlreadyUsedError: Slug is already in use, please choose another one.

source.label: See code
source.help: Displays the App structure in raw format

disabled.label: Disabled
disabled.description: A disabled app will never be executed but simply ignored

confirm.alreadyPublished: The workspace is already published as an app with this name, which can't be changed
confirm.slugInvalid: Only allowed characters are letters, numbers, whitespaces, . _ and -
confirm.title: Publish the workspace as an app
confirm.content:
Automations, Pages, Blocks as well as Workspace configuration will be accessible to anyone installing your App.
First, remove any private API key you want to keep private.

duplicate.help: Create a copy of this Page

source.label: See code
source.help: Displays the Page structure in raw format

empty.title: <0>This page is empty…</0><1>Start creating, add your first block!</1>
empty.subtitle: Not sure where to start?

header.title: Header
header.text: Present your brand with your logo and navigation

form.title: Form
form.text: Need to get leads? Add a form

confirm.title: Do you want to delete the page "{{name}}"?
confirm.content: Warning, the data will be lost.

save.label: Save
save.reason_AlreadyUsedError: Slug is already in use, please choose another one.

share.label: Share this page
share.copy: Copy the public address of the page
share.copied: The address is copied into your clipboard
share.notme: You are already the owner of this Page.

styles.label: CSS styles of the page
styles.description: You can edit the style sheet of your web page to customize it. Don't hesitate to add identifiers to your blocks to be able to target them with the # prefix in your CSS.

reset.label: Reset
reset.description: Revert to the default theme. ⚠️ You will lose your changes.

onInit.label: Initial event
onInit.description: This event will be triggered during the initialization of the block each time the page is viewed.

updateOn.label: Update event
updateOn.description: When one of your automations emits this event, the content of the block will be updated with the content of the payload.

automation.label: Automation
automation.description: Run an automation at page load to retrieve the block configuration.

sectionId.label: HTML identifier of the section
sectionId.description: Allows you to identify the section to apply particular CSS styles or point a link to it like an automatic scroll. Optional.

action.title: Action
action.description: Action triggered by a click on the card

valueEvent.label: Event to trigger
valueEvent.description: The name of the event that will be sent to the click.

popup.label: Open in new tab
popup.description: Opens the link in a new tab instead of replacing the current page.

payload.label: Payload
payload.description: Data object that accompanies the event.

className.label: Element class name
className.description: Specify a custom class for the element containing the Block to facilitate the layout in CSS.

css.label: CSS styles applied to the Block
css.description: You can use the keyword ":block" to target the element containing the Block.

blocks.name: {{context}}
blocks.description_RichText: Display text formatted with Markdown or HTML
blocks.description_StackedNavigation: Display navigable block pages. Must be used through automations.
blocks.description_BlocksSplit: Display two blocks with expansible border
blocks.description_Action: Display an action button capable of navigating to a link, a page, a section of the page or triggering an event.
blocks.description_Carousel: Displaying Blocks in a horizontal Carousel

level.label: Title level
level.description: Defines the level of the tag applied to the title.

logo.label: Logo
logo.description: Image displayed next to the title. Optional.

alt.label: Alternative text
alt.description: Text displayed in place of the image for non-graphical browsers.

nav.label: Navigation
nav.description: You can add links to web addresses or buttons sending events.

external.label: External page
external.description: HTTP address to any web page

value.label: Web address
value.description: Indicate the web address of the page (https://...).

popup.label: Open in new tab
popup.description: Enable to have the page open in a new tab instead of replacing the current page.

value.label: Page
value.description: Choose a page in your Workspace.

inside.label: Scroll to a section
inside.description: Anchor in this same page. You can define an anchor name in the "Advanced" section of any Block's settings.

value.label: Block ID
value.description: Choose one of the blocks on your page to scroll to.

event.label: Trigger an event
event.description: The defined event will be triggered on this action. You can then proceed to an Automation.

value.label: Event
value.description: Specify the name of the event to be triggered.

text.label: Button text
text.description: Text displayed in the navigation button.

fixed.label: Fixed header
fixed.description: If enabled, the header will remain hanging at the top of the screen during the scroll.

settings.label: Buttons
settings.description: You can add as many buttons as you want.

tag.label: Tag
tag.description: Text to be displayed in a label on the right of the button

unselected.label: Unselected
unselected.description: Displays the button in a secondary, grayed out state. Used for example to indicate an inactive tab

autoscroll.label: Auto scroll
autoscroll.description: You can activate and configure the automatic scrolling of the content.

active.label: Activate
active.description: Activate automatic scrolling. Scrolling will still be possible manually with the buttons and the keyboard.

speed.label: Scroll speed
speed.description: Setting the page change speed in seconds.

text.value_description: You can use HTML or Markdown.

button.url_description: The button can be a link to a web page.
button.popup: Open the link in a new tab
button.popup_description: The link will open in a new tab.
button.event_description: The button can trigger an event.

accordion.title: Title
accordion.content_description: Hidden content. Can be HTML or markdown.

content.label: Contenu de la carte
content.description: Composez votre carte à l'aide de Blocks

layout.title: Layout
layout.description: You can change the display mode. By default, cards will be displayed using a carousel.

autoScroll.title: Auto scroll
autoScroll.description: Activate this option to have the carousel scroll automatically every 5 seconds

data.label: Table of data to be displayed
data.description: This block waits for an array of objects whose structure is at your convenience but identical for each element of the array.

items.label: Line
items.description: The keys of the object will be the columns of the table.

columns.label: Columns
columns.description: Specifying the columns. If you don't change anything, all your data will be displayed as raw.

key.label: Key
key.description: The key corresponding to the data to be displayed

type.label: Type
type.description: The type of data format. By default, the data is displayed as text

format.label: Format
format.description: Format to apply to the data in case of number or date type.

actions.label: Action buttons
actions.description: You can display action buttons if you have not chosen a key

items.label: Action button
items.description: What does the action button do?

event.label: Event
event.description: A click on the button will send an event

payload.label: Payload
payload.description: The event can be sent with data

url.label: URL
url.description: A click on the button will open a new page. The URL can contain parameters in the form {{key}}. For example, if data contains a "_id" property, the URL can be "http://host/user/{{_id}}" and will be filled with the value of the concerned line

onEdit.label: Event on edition
onEdit.description: Makes the cell editable. The event passed in value will be sent each time it is modified

pagination.label: Manual pagination
pagination.description: By default, paging is done automatically on all the data sent. If you want to paginate on the server side, use this configuration structure.

event.label: Event
event.description: Name of the event sent when a page is changed. The number of the requested page will be send in payload.

page.label: Current page number
page.description: Will display the number of the page displayed.

customProps.label: Additional properties
customProps.description: Additional properties to send to the Table, as supported by ant design : https://ant.design/components/table

submitLabel.label: Submit button text
submitLabel.description: Modify the text of the form validation button

hideSubmit.label: Hide submit button
hideSubmit.description: You can hide the form validation button, for example if you prefer to validate the form as you type.

onSubmit.label: On submit event
onSubmit.description: When the form is validated, the event will be sent with all its values.

onChange.label: On change event
onChange.description: Each time the form is modified, the event will be sent with all its values.

schema.label: Form specification
schema.description: Use the form builder interface to add the fields of your choice.

disabledSubmit.label: Disable the validation button
disabledSubmit.description: Allows you to disable the form validation button. This parameter is useful to be sent by an Automation during the operation of the page, for example immediately after receiving the event corresponding to onSubmit, to show the user that his request is taken into account.

content.label: Content in HTML or Markdown format
content.description: Here you can display any rich content using HTML or Markdown. You can even mix the two.

allowScripts.label: Allow scripts
allowScripts.description: Allow execution of javascript code included in <script> tags

values.label: Interpolated values
values.description: You can insert values using the {{variableName}} notation into your HTML content.

markdown.label: Interpreting content as Markdown
markdown.description: Your content can contain both HTML and Markdown for easy formatting. However, if you prefer to keep it unaltered by the Markdown rendering engine, enable this option.

container.label: HTML tag containing
container.description: Your rich text will be contained in a <div> tag by default. You can choose another one by indicating it here.

content.label: Content
content.description: You can customize this section with a list of any available Blocks.

img.label: Image
img.description: Une image idéealement au format carré et de bonne taille.

backgroundColor.label: Couleur de fond
backgroundColor.description: La couleur de fond du Hero.

level.label: Title level
level.description: Defines the level of the tag applied to the title.

blocks.label: Blocks
blocks.description: You can complete your content with a list of Blocks.

blocks.label: Blocks
blocks.description: You can complete your content with a list of Blocks.

content.label: Footer content
content.description: You can configure your footer using a list of Blocks.

src.label: Image
src.description: Choose an image on your storage space.

caption.label: Caption
caption.description: Enter a text to accompany your image.

alt.label: Textual alternative
alt.description: Text describing the image to help with accessibility.

links.label: Links
links.description: Breadcrumb links in order of display.

href.label: Link to one of your Pages
href.description: Web address to one of your Workspace's Page.

tabs.label: Tabs
tabs.description: Define your tabs and their associated content

content.label: Content
content.description: The content displayed when the onget is selected.

exit.confirm_message: You are about to leave without saving. Are you sure?

save.fail: Your workspace is invalid and could not be saved.

404: This workspace does not exist. Return to your home page.

share.label: Share
share.leave: You no longer have access to the {{name}} Workspace.
share.notme: You are already the owner of this Workspace.

confirm.title: Do you want to delete "{{name}}" ?
confirm.title_workspaces: Do you want to delete the "{{name}}" Workspace?
confirm.title_automation: Do you want to delete the "{{name}}" automation?
confirm.title_pages: Do you want to delete the "{{name}}" page?
confirm.content: Warning, the data will be lost.
confirm.content_apps: Are you sure you want to remove "{{name}}" from your workspace ?

description.label: Field description
description.description: This text will be displayed in a bubble exactly like this one.

placeholder.label: Placeholder
placeholder.description: This text will be shown inside the input.

type.label: Type of value
type.description: The value will be of the type you specify

widget.label: Display mode
widget.description: Each type offers a particular display, but some offer alternatives. For example, you can force the choice of a date with the Date display.

enum.label: List of specific values
enum.description: You can impose a value from a specific selection. A drop-down menu will then be displayed to the user.

widget.default_description: A basic field related to the value type.
widget.name: {{context}}
widget.description_upload: An upload area will be displayed. The file will be uploaded to our cloud and the url will be stored as a value in your data object.
widget.description_textarea: A more comfortable writing area than a simple field.
widget.description_date: A calendar will be displayed. The value will be formatted as a date.
widget.description_enum: You choose the list of possible values. Only one of these values will be allowed.
widget.description_radio: List of values in the form of radio buttons
widget.description_slider: Select a numeric value on a slider

items.label: Items
items.description: Definition of each element of the table

allowNew.title: Allow new entris
allowNew.description: Allow additional properties, other than the listed ones

feed.type_workspaces.configured: The Workspace configuration has been updated
feed.type_workspaces.apps.installed: The {{appSlug}} app has been installed as <app>{{appName}}</app>
feed.type_workspaces.versions.published: The <tooltip title="{{event.payload.version.description}}">{{event.payload.version.name}}</tooltip> version has been created. <rollback>Rollback to this version</rollback>
feed.type_workspaces.permissions.shared: The Workspace has been shared with {{share}}
feed.type_workspaces.permissions.deleted: The Workspace is no longer shared with {{share}}
feed.type_runtime.webhooks.triggered: The automation <automation>{{automation}}</automation> was triggered by URL
feed.type_runtime.schedules.triggered: The automation <automation>{{automation}}</automation> was triggered according to its schedule
feed.type_runtime.waits.fulfilled: The automation <automation>{{automation}}</automation> allowed another to resume following the event <event>{{event}}</event>
feed.type_apikeys.updated: An API key has been updated
feed.type_apikeys.created: An API key has been created
feed.type_apikeys.deleted: An API key has been deleted
feed.replay: Emit this event again with same payload.

form.raw: Insert a raw value (allows you to enter text, and therefore interpolated variables)
form.raw_hide: Respect the type of data required
form.html_hide: Be careful, by returning to the simple editing mode, you risk losing tags or HTML attributes not managed by it.

name.label: Choice of Block
name.description: Choose a Block among those proposed by Prisme.ai and those from the Apps you have installed on your Workspace.
